output.conclusion: Upon completion of this course, students will be equipped with essential patient care techniques, enabling them to provide safe, effective, and compassionate care in various healthcare settings.
output.introduction: This course provides an intermediate-level overview of essential patient care techniques. It is designed for healthcare professionals seeking to enhance their skills in providing safe and effective patient care.

chapters.description: Learn the proper techniques for measuring and interpreting vital signs, including temperature, pulse, respiration, and blood pressure.
Understand different pain scales and methods for assessing a patient's pain level effectively and accurately.
Explore techniques for safe patient transfers, positioning, and ambulation to prevent injuries to both patients and healthcare providers.
Overview of using walkers, canes, crutches, and wheelchairs to aid patient mobility.
Learn about basic wound assessment, cleaning, and dressing techniques to promote healing and prevent infection.
Understand standard precautions and transmission-based precautions to prevent the spread of infections in healthcare settings.
Understand different routes of medication administration (oral, topical, subcutaneous, intramuscular) and related safety considerations.
Learn about the 5 rights of medication administration and strategies for preventing medication errors.
